intro: Trichochloa longiflora, commonly known as the slender spikegrass, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a member of the Poaceae family, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, spike-like inflorescences. The plant produces small, white to pale blue flowers that are clustered in dense spikes, typically blooming during the rainy season. Trichochloa longiflora is often found in open grasslands and disturbed soils, and it plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for small invertebrates.
